meanings.definition: Work from home using a computer or telephone.
meanings.sent1: I telecommute to my job every day.
meanings.sent2: She prefers to telecommute rather than commute to the office.
meanings.sent3: John decided to telecommute so he could avoid rush hour traffic.
meanings.sent4: Telecommuting allows employees to be virtually present at work.
meanings.sent5: Telecommuting has made working from home more common and convenient.

meanings.definition: To work remotely from a different location than the office.
meanings.sent1: Employees often telecommute when they travel for business.
meanings.sent2: They telecommute to collaborate with colleagues from afar.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to telecommute for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: Telecommuting can bridge the gap between work and personal life.
meanings.sent5: Telecommuting offers flexibility and freedom in where you work.
